intro: Euphrasia hachijoensis, commonly known as the Hachijo Island eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Japanese island of Hachijo-jima. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers with dark veins. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Euphrasia hachijoensis is a rare and endemic species, making it of particular interest to botanists and conservationists.
